comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: try to always make a little patience to your post made for reply and also try to post pretty good enough that members could finds it fascinating enough to engage on a discussion, just gibe a look at other threads here and see hoe they make their post look quality enough for a deserving reply, and on the other end this your question isn't clear enough to receive comments as it has been discussed on several occasions on the gambling board here, just try make a search through.

comments.author: perla
comments.body: There are plenty of bonuses available, that's no problem at all. I would just be careful about what kind of bonus you accept when you try a gambling site and make a deposit. There can be quite a few conditions attached to it and people normally don't feel like it. but you really have to check if you want to go through all these requirements.

comments.author: Haunebu
comments.body: There are a couple of options available op. Firstly, there are dedicated sports betting sites like Sportsbet.io which offer decent welcome bonuses which I utilised well when I joined their site. They provide other kinds of bonuses too(Boosts etc).Secondly, there are casino+sportsbook sites that don't really offer great welcome bonuses, but their VIP systems are great. Examples are Stake, Roobet(KYC) etc.

comments.author: BitcoinAccepted
comments.body: Sites mentioned and from the forum are okay in themselves. And the points mentioned regarding the terms and conditions do not apply to every site. You also have sites where you get a bonus without your money being tied up, you can just do with your balance what you want in the background and collect the bonus points so to speak. That seems more convenient to me.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: If you want rakeback bonus, you can check Gamdom (15%) or Stake (10%).If you want deposit bonus, you can check Bitlucy (it's still new sites and currently under maintenance, be careful).Most of trustworthy and old bookies doesn't offer welcome bonus since that promotion purpose to attract new gamblers. While the old one will try how to make the gamblers stay on their bookies and they mostly offer a multi bet insurance, odds boost etc.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Promo like welcome bonus are often for new sports betting sites, you'd have to be on the look out for the new ones. If you want sports betting sites that always have promos try the sportsbet.io or stake.com, it may not be a welcome bonus but you'll see what you get when you signup and try them.  They giveaway like free bets and so forth.^ Check this moonbet which is new.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: There's not many sportsbooks that offer welcome bonuses but trustdice is still offering a risk-free bet on your first sports bet. There used to be more sportsbooks that had some sort of similar bonus for new users like fortunejack and sportsbet but later on, they removed it and shifted their focus on launching several promotions for their regular players. https://trustdice.win/promotions/sports-welcome-freebet

comments.author: slaman29
comments.body: Quote from: ralle14 on May 16, 2022, 03:55:56 AMThere's not many sportsbooks that offer welcome bonuses but trustdice is still offering a risk-free bet on your first sports bet. There used to be more sportsbooks that had some sort of similar bonus for new users like fortunejack and sportsbet but later on, they removed it and shifted their focus on launching several promotions for their regular players. Really? FortuneJack still offers a welcome bonus, with some wagering requirements, but much lower for the new user on sports.Sportsbet never offered me a welcome bonus but they sure as heck still give out plenty of risk-free bets every week (you just need to predict outcomes and you win prizes as freebets). Or, you stay active in chat and they drop freebets every week too if you happen to be awake when their radio crew is on (which I'm unfortunately not being in Asia). I've seen new players get it as soon as they come in and say hello

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: Quote from: Sensetive03 on May 15, 2022, 12:43:13 PMi wonder .. When a gambling site gives an offer to give a welcome bonus, they also add terms and conditions to their members. So when a member deposits $XX, they are eligible to get the welcome bonus. If the site has a reputation, that will not be a problem. But if the site is too shady, that will be too risky to use their welcome bonus because we do not know if there are any other terms and conditions behind that.I wonder do you already search by yourself? I do not know about 22bet but in this forum, you can find many crypto sports betting sites and they have many good promotions you can take but always follow their rule.
